description: Coach asks for a diagram showing the optimal spacing for a 4‑2‑3‑1 formation against a high press; the assistant ingests game footage, pulls player statistics, retrieves high‑press tactical theory, analyses defensive patterns, creates coaching recommendations and finally generates a visual spacing diagram.

messages.content: You are PlayMinder Coach, an expert virtual sports strategy coach. You can ingest game video, fetch player statistics, retrieve tactical theory, analyse play patterns, generate coaching recommendations and create visual diagrams. Respond in a conversational tone, ask for any missing information, and use the appropriate tools to fulfill the coach's request.
I need a diagram showing the optimal spacing for our 4‑2‑3‑1 formation when we’re up against a high‑pressing opponent.

Got it! To give you a data‑driven spacing diagram I’ll need the latest match video and the player IDs you want to analyse. Could you share the video URL and the list of the ten outfield players you’ll be using in the 4‑2‑3‑1?

Sure, here’s the video: https://example.com/match2024/fullmatch.mp4. The players are: 
- P001 (GK) 
- P002 (RB) 
- P003 (CB1) 
- P004 (CB2) 
- P005 (LB) 
- P006 (CDM) 
- P007 (CM) 
- P008 (CAM) 
- P009 (ST) 
- P010 (RW) 
- P011 (LW)
Thanks! I’ll now ingest the video and pull the latest season stats for the listed players.
The video and player data are ready. I’ll pull a concise description of the “high press” tactical concept so we’re aligned on the opponent’s style.

{"tactic_name": "high press", "description": "A defensive approach where the team aggressively pressures the ball holder high up the pitch, aiming to win possession in the opponent's half. It forces quick decisions, limits passing lanes, and often employs a high defensive line with coordinated pressing triggers."}
Based on the high‑press description, I’ll analyse defensive patterns in the uploaded match, focusing on how your back‑four and double pivot behaved when the opponent applied pressure.

{"analysis_id": "analysis_def_2024_09_15", "key_findings": [{"phase": "first 15 minutes", "issue": "wide gaps between RB and CDM when press triggered", "frequency": 8}, {"phase": "second half", "issue": "LB often caught out of position after forward runs", "frequency": 5}], "overall_score": 6.4}

I’ve identified two main spacing issues: (1) a gap between the right‑back and the defensive midfield when the press starts, and (2) the left‑back getting isolated after overlapping runs. I’ll now generate concrete recommendations to tighten the 4‑2‑3‑1 shape against a high press.

{"recommendation_id": "rec_2024_09_15", "actions": [{"player": "P002 (RB)", "instruction": "Stay tighter to CDM (P006) when opponent presses, delay forward run until ball is secured."}, {"player": "P005 (LB)", "instruction": "Maintain a shallow defensive line, avoid committing to overlapping runs unless the ball is on the opposite flank."}, {"player": "P006 (CDM)", "instruction": "Drop slightly deeper to fill the gap between the back‑four and midfield during press phases."}, {"player": "P007 (CM)", "instruction": "Offer a short passing option to the CDM, acting as a safety valve."}], "diagram_note": "All players should occupy a compact rectangle 30‑40 m wide and 20 m deep when the press triggers."}
Great, the recommendations are ready. I’ll now create a visual diagram illustrating the optimal player positions and movement zones for the compact 4‑2‑3‑1 against a high press.

{"visualization_url": "https://example.com/visuals/spacing_4-2-3-1_highpress_20240915.png", "format": "png", "description": "Compact 4‑2‑3‑1 spacing diagram with highlighted safe zones and movement arrows."}

Here’s the spacing diagram you asked for. The image shows a compact rectangle for the back‑four and double pivot, with arrows indicating the recommended positions and movement constraints for each player when facing a high press. Use this visual in your next training session to reinforce the shape.

![Spacing Diagram](https://example.com/visuals/spacing_4-2-3-1_highpress_20240915.png)

Let me know if you’d like any tweaks or additional tactical notes!
